docs.lead_paragraph: Children as young as 2 can be given a nasal spray flu vaccine, a federal advisory panel said Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: N.F.L. owners voted unanimously Wednesday to commit $10 million to a program that will help pay for medical care for retired players in financial need.

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students share ideas about a lede for a breaking news story regarding the California wildfires. They then brainstorm angles for a series of news items and write analysis papers that address the tone and content of a piece published in The Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pennsylvania's two largest health insurers, which in March agreed to merge, won't know whether they will be able to go ahead with the deal until next summer, at the earliest.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Insurance Merger Review Won't Be Done Until 2008

docs.abstract: Pennsylvania's two largest health insurers, which in March agreed to merge, won't know whether they will be able to go ahead with the deal until next summer, at the earliest. State regulators said it would take that long to review the deal between the insurers, Independence Blue Cross and Highmark, a deal that had been [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Pete Stark, Democrat of California, escaped a censure Tuesday for incendiary remarks he made last week about President Bush and the war in Iraq.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the largest successful organizing drive in New York City in half a century, 28,000 child care providers will join the city’s teachers’ union as the result of an overwhelmingly pro-union vote.

headline.main: Child Care Workers in New York City Vote to Unionize
headline.sub: A Decision by Spitzer Paved the Way;
headline.print_headline: Child Care Workers in New York City Vote to Unionize

docs.snippet: In the largest successful organizing drive in New York City in half a century, 28,000 child care providers will join the city’s teachers’ union as the result of an overwhelmingly pro-union vote.
